page.title: 03HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: { Historic Buildings PENCAITLAND {Parish Church} _The foundations were built in the 12th century, the Winton Aisle in the 13th century.The nave was probably built in the 1500's and the tower was added in 1631.{Pencaitland} {House}- The main building was burnt down in 1875, during a fire. Today, two detached pavillions, built in the 17th century, and the outhouses still stand.{The Old Schoolhouse.} - In Wester Pencaitland is the old schoolhouse. There is a statue of studious boy above the door.{The Old School}- There is another old school, but at the other end of the village.It was built in 1870, and enlarged in 1887. It is now a recording studio in frequent use{.The Trevelyan Hall}- It was errected for Mr. Arthur Trevelyan, and it is now the main village hall.
